intro: Phlegmariurus holstii, commonly known as the Holst's haircap, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, overlapping leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, hair-like structures. This moss thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Phlegmariurus holstii plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
